channel.title: Comments on: SQL Query Commenting/Uncommenting Quick Tip
channel.description: A Technical Community for IT Professionals

item.title: By: Erik
item.dc:creator: Erik
item.description: I sure miss Ctrl-B ... to move the horizontal splitter bar between the code and the query results up and down with the keyboard. :( :( :(
item.content:encoded: I sure miss Ctrl-B … to move the horizontal splitter bar between the code and the query results up and down with the keyboard. üôÅ üôÅ üôÅ

item.title: By: mike good
item.dc:creator: mike good
item.description: I like this trick, never thought of it. But even more, I like "2000 setup in SSMS" -- never heard of that either. 30sec after reading this post, my SSMS now runs with the "SQL 2000" keyboard scheme and I'm back to using Ctrl-C and Ctrl-R. My thanks to both of you.
item.content:encoded: I like this trick, never thought of it. But even more, I like “2000 setup in SSMS” — never heard of that either. 30sec after reading this post, my SSMS now runs with the “SQL 2000” keyboard scheme and I’m back to using Ctrl-C and Ctrl-R. My thanks to both of you.

item.title: By: SQLDenis
item.dc:creator: SQLDenis
item.content:encoded:
Neat way…..of course only you could have come up with this üôÇ

This is one of the reasons I always use #temp tables instead of variable…..so that I can just run the stuff I need

I always use CTRL + C/ CTRL + R (I used 2000 setup in SSMS)
